dotenv.cli

Functions

enumerate_env()

Return a path for the ${pwd}/.env file.

cli(→ None)

This script is used to set, get or unset values from a .env file.

stream_file(→ Iterator[IO[str]])

Open a file and yield the corresponding (decoded) stream.

list(→ None)

Display all the stored key/value.

set(→ None)

Store the given key/value.

get(→ None)

Retrieve the value for the given key.

unset(→ None)

Removes the given key.

run(→ None)

Run command with environment variables present.

run_command(→ int)

Run command in sub process.

Module Contents

dotenv.cli.enumerate_env()[source]

Return a path for the ${pwd}/.env file.

If pwd does not exist, return None.

dotenv.cli.cli(ctx: click.Context, file: Any, quote: Any, export: Any) → None[source]

This script is used to set, get or unset values from a .env file.

dotenv.cli.stream_file(path: os.PathLike) → Iterator[IO[str]][source]

Open a file and yield the corresponding (decoded) stream.

Exits with error code 2 if the file cannot be opened.

dotenv.cli.list(ctx: click.Context, format: bool) → None[source]

Display all the stored key/value.

dotenv.cli.set(ctx: click.Context, key: Any, value: Any) → None[source]

Store the given key/value.

dotenv.cli.get(ctx: click.Context, key: Any) → None[source]

Retrieve the value for the given key.

dotenv.cli.unset(ctx: click.Context, key: Any) → None[source]

Removes the given key.

dotenv.cli.run(ctx: click.Context, override: bool, commandline: List[str]) → None[source]

Run command with environment variables present.

dotenv.cli.run_command(command: List[str], env: Dict[str, str]) → int[source]

Run command in sub process.

Runs the command in a sub process with the variables from env added in the current environment variables.

Parameters:

  • command (List[str]) – The command and it’s parameters

  • env (Dict) – The additional environment variables

Returns:

The return code of the command

Return type:

int
